interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2020/01/21
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Brian Brough'], 'Producers': ['Brian Brough', 'Steven A. Lee', 'Brittany Wiscombe'], 'Starring': ['Rachel Skarsten', 'Brant Daugherty', 'Jill Adler'], 'Studio': ['SunWorld Pictures']}
Review Text: I like movies like this during the no-Christmas season. Sometimes I am SO disappointed in the actors. It is like the story drags on forever compared to movies that go to theater first. I will stop after 10-20 minutes in if I just cannot deal with it.  This story, I liked the liner and that it had 5 stars. Although the supporting actors and actresses left me wanting, the leads were REALLY good. The conversation flowed. The story line was so unique. I have had premonitions of my own in the past, and things like these could really happen. Believable characters and story made this something that I enjoyed immensely. I have seen the supporting actors in other movies, and some of them have done better I those roles, but overall. LOVED the locations and the way photography and writing were brought in. It actually was a motivating movie, that all we need is for ONE person to believe in us sometimes. And that we should not wait for something major to happen in our lives to reevaluate our current life-course. Will most likely watch it again with my girls. They LOVE movies like this, and they are hard to find. No sex, no swearing, no inappropriate content.
Review Title: Surprisingly better than I expected. Good acting by leads.
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

- **Cast and Production Values:** They favor films with acclaimed actors and respected producers, which significantly impacts their enjoyment.

Their family particularly enjoys the types of movies they seek, emphasizing the challenge of finding quality options that align with their values.
